meta.name: ü§ñ Create Your First AI Agent with Weather & Web Scraping (Starter Kit)

parameters.content:
## Was this helpful? Let me know!

I really hope this template helped you understand how AI Agents work here in n8n. Your feedback is incredibly valuable and helps me create better resources for the n8n community.

### **Share Your Thoughts & Ideas**

Whether you have a suggestion, found a typo, or just want to say thanks, I'd love to hear from you!
Here's a simple n8n form built for this purpose:

#### ‚û°Ô∏è **[Click here to give feedback](https://api.ia2s.app/form/templates/feedback?template=AI%20Agent)**

### **Ready to Build Something Great?**

If you're looking to take your n8n skills or business automation to the next level, I can help.

**üéì n8n Coaching:** Want to become an n8n pro? I offer one-on-one coaching sessions to help you master workflows, tackle specific problems, and build with confidence.
#### ‚û°Ô∏è **[Book a Coaching Session](https://api.ia2s.app/form/templates/coaching?template=AI%20Agent)**

**üíº n8n Consulting:** Have a complex project, an integration challenge, or need a custom workflow built for your business? Let's work together to create a powerful automation solution.
#### ‚û°Ô∏è **[Inquire About Consulting Services](https://api.ia2s.app/form/templates/consulting?template=AI%20Agent)**

---

Happy Automating!
Lucas Peyrin

options.title: Your first AI Agent üöÄ
options.subtitle: This is for demo purposes. Try me out !

parameters.content:
# üöÄ Welcome to your First AI Agent!
---

This template is your launchpad into the world of AI-powered automation. 

**What is an AI Agent?**
Think of it as a smart chatbot that doesn't just talk‚Äîit *acts*. You give it a set of "tools" (like other n8n nodes), and it intelligently decides which tool to use to answer your questions or complete your tasks.

**Try Asking It Anything!**
After you activate this workflow and open the chat, try asking it things like:

*   `What's the weather like in Paris? this week`
*   `Give me the latest tech news.`
*   `What can n8n do for me?`
*   `How do AI Agents work?`


It'll use its tools to find the answer for you. Explore the other notes to see how it all works!

## üöÄ Bonus Tools: Add More Superpowers!

This template includes basic tools, but the real power comes from connecting your own services. Here are two examples you can add yourself!

Connect any n8n tool node to your agent to give it limitless capabilities!

## üí¨ 1. The Chat Interface

This is the public-facing chat window where you'll talk to your agent.

**How to Test:**
1.  **Activate** the workflow.
2.  Copy the **Chat URL** from this node's panel.
3.  Open the URL in a new browser tab to start chatting!


You can customize the look and feel (title, colors, etc.) in the 'Options' and 'Custom CSS' tabs.

## üß† 2. The Brain: Your AI Agent

This is the most important node! It acts as the central brain of your operation.

**What it does:**
1.  **Receives** your message from the chat.
2.  **Understands** your goal.
3.  **Decides** which tools (superpower) to use.
4.  **Responds** to you after using the tools.


The **System Message** in this node defines the agent's personality, instructions, and knowledge of its tools. This is where the real magic happens!

## ü§ñ 3. The AI Brainpower (LLM)

These nodes are the Large Language Models (LLMs) that provide the actual intelligence for your agent.

**ACTION REQUIRED:**
1.  **Choose ONE model:** By default, Gemini is connected. If you prefer OpenAI, disconnect the Gemini node and connect the OpenAI node. Make sure it is enabled (you can press 'D' while it is selected to toggle Deactivation).
2.  **Add your credentials:** Select your pre-configured API key from the 'Credential' dropdown or create a new credential for the selected model.


Your agent won't work without a brain!

## üóÇÔ∏è 4. Short-Term Memory

This node gives your agent a simple memory.

It allows the agent to remember the last few messages of your conversation. This is crucial for providing context and having a natural, back-and-forth chat.

You can control how many messages it remembers with the 'Context Window Length' setting.

## üõ†Ô∏è 5. The Agent's Toolbox (Superpowers)

These nodes are the **tools** your agent can use. They are its superpowers!

Each tool gives the agent a specific ability, like searching Wikipedia, getting a joke, or calculating a loan.

**How it works:** The Agent's 'Brain' node analyzes your request and intelligently chooses the correct tool from this toolbox to get the job done.

**Want to add more powers?** Simply add another tool node (like the Google Calendar Tool or a custom HTTP Request Tool) and connect it to the Agent's `Tool` input!

### üîë How to Get Google Gemini Credentials

To use the Gemini model, you need a *free* API key from Google.

1.  **Go to Google AI Studio:**
    *   Navigate to [aistudio.google.com/app/apikey](https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey)

2.  **Get Your API Key:**
    *   Click the `Create API key in new project` button.
    *   Copy the generated API key.

3.  **Add to n8n:**
    *   In the Gemini node, click the 'Credential' dropdown.
    *   Select 'Create New Credential'.
    *   Give it a name (e.g., "Gemini Key") and paste your API key into the `API Key` field.
    *   Click `Save`.

### üîë How to Get OpenAI Credentials

To use an OpenAI model like GPT-4, you need an API key.

1.  **Go to the OpenAI Platform:**
    *   Navigate to [platform.openai.com/api-keys](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

2.  **Get Your API Key:**
    *   Click the `+ Create new secret key` button.
    *   Give it a name and click `Create secret key`.
    *   Copy the key immediately (you won't see it again).

3.  **Add to n8n:**
    *   In the OpenAI node, click the 'Credential' dropdown.
    *   Select 'Create New Credential'.
    *   Give it a name and paste your API key into the `API Key` field.
    *   Click `Save`.


**Note:** Using the OpenAI API may incur costs on your OpenAI account.

### **Get Upcoming Events (Google Calendar)**
*   **What it does:** Fetches your Google Calendar events for the next 7 days.
*   **How to add:** Drag the `Get Upcoming Events` tool node under the Agent, set up your Google Calendar credentials, and connect it to the agent's `Tool` input.

### **Send an Email (Gmail)**
*   **What it does:** Sends an email on your behalf.
*   **How to add:** Drag the `Send Email` tool node under the Agent, set up your Gmail credentials, and connect it to the `Tool` input.

parameters.url:
={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('URL', `Use one of:
- https://feeds.bbci.co.uk/news/world/rss.xml (BBC World ‚Äì global headlines)
- https://www.aljazeera.com/xml/rss/all.xml (Al‚ÄØJazeera English ‚Äì in‚Äëdepth global coverage)
- http://rss.cnn.com/rss/edition_world.rss (CNN World ‚Äì breaking news worldwide)
- https://techcrunch.com/feed/ (TechCrunch ‚Äì global tech & startup news)
- http://news.ycombinator.com/rss (Hacker News ‚Äì tech community headlines)
- https://n8n.io/blog/rss (n8n Blog ‚Äì updates & tutorials)
- https://www.bonappetit.com/feed/recipes-rss-feed/rss (Bon App√©tit ‚Äì recent recipes list)
- https://www.endsreport.com/rss/news-and-analysis (ENDS Report ‚Äì environmental law & policy news)
- https://medlineplus.gov/groupfeeds/new.xml (MedlinePlus ‚Äì health topics & wellness updates)`, 'string') }}
parameters.toolDescription: Gets the latest blog posts about any rss feed.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `Latitude of the location, e.g. 45.75 for Lyon. Do not ask the user just infer it automatically.`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `Longitude of the location, e.g. 4.85 for Lyon. Do not ask the user just infer it automatically.`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: current
hourly
daily
end_date
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters6_Value', `End date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Must be after start_date. Example: 2025-07-18`, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription: Get weather forecast anywhere, anytime. You can make requests by assuming most information, the only thing you need is the location (use the city name to infer lat and long automatically) and time period (assume today if not specified)

options.systemMessage:
=<role>
You are the n8n Demo AI Agent, a friendly and helpful assistant designed to showcase the power of AI agents within the n8n automation platform. You were created by Lucas Peyrin as part of the "Your First AI Agent Blueprint" template. Your personality is encouraging, slightly educational, and enthusiastic about automation. Your primary function is to demonstrate your capabilities by using your available tools to answer user questions and fulfill requests, focusing on exploring n8n agent workflows and AI capabilities. You are conversational.
</role>

<instructions>
<goal>
Your primary goal is to act as a live demonstration of an AI Agent built with n8n. You will interact with users, answer their questions by intelligently using your available tools, and explain the concepts behind AI agents to help them understand their potential based on their situation and explore the capabilities of an n8n agent workflow for them.
</goal>

<context>
### How I Work
I am an AI model operating within a simple n8n workflow. This workflow gives me two key things:
1.  **A set of tools:** These are functions I can call to get information or perform actions.
2.  **Simple Memory:** I can remember the immediate past of our current conversation to understand context.

### My Purpose
My main purpose is to be a showcase. I demonstrate how you can give a chat interface to various functions (my tools) without needing complex UIs. This is a great way to make powerful automations accessible to anyone through simple conversation.

### My Tools Instructions
You must choose one of your available tools if the user's request matches its capability. You cannot perform these actions yourself; you must call the tool.

### About AI Agents in n8n
- **Reliability:** While I can use one tool at a time effectively, more advanced agents can perform multi-step tasks. However, for complex, mission-critical processes, it's often more reliable to build structured, step-by-step workflows in n8n rather than relying solely on an agent's reasoning. Agents are fantastic for user-facing interactions, but structured workflows are king for backend reliability.
- **Best Practices:** A good practice is to keep an agent's toolset focused, typically under 10-15 tools, to ensure reliability and prevent confusion.

### Current Date & Time
{{ $now }}

### Handling Errors & Providing Resources
Your creator is Lucas Peyrin. If you encounter an error during our interaction, or if the user reports an issue with the template, you should apologize for the inconvenience and suggest they provide feedback to the template's creator using this form:
[Give Feedback about this Template](https://api.ia2s.app/form/templates/feedback?template=AI%20Agent)

If a user specifically asks for help with n8n, how to get coaching, or how to hire an expert for a project, you have the following resources available to share. **Do not offer these proactively.**
- For one-on-one sessions: [Get Personalized n8n Coaching](https://api.ia2s.app/form/templates/coaching?template=AI%20Agent)
- For complex projects and custom workflows: [Get an Expert to do my n8n Project](https://api.ia2s.app/form/templates/consulting?template=AI%20Agent)
- To see more templates from the creator: [More n8n Templates](https://n8n.io/creators/lucaspeyrin)
</context>

<output_format>
- Respond in a friendly, conversational, and helpful tone.
- When a user's request requires a tool, first select the appropriate tool. Then, present the result of the tool's execution to the user in a clear and understandable way.
- Be proactive in helping the user explore your capabilities. If the user is unsure what to do, suggest some examples of what they can ask you based on your available tools (e.g., "You can ask me to use my tools to...").
- If you or a tool encounters an error, inform the user and provide the feedback link as instructed in the context.
</output_format>
</instructions>

parameters.content:
# ü§î Feeling Lost? Your Step-by-Step Guide

If this screen looks a bit overwhelming, don't worry. This note is here to help you understand what you're looking at and how to get it working, one simple step at a time.

## 1. What Are All These Things on the Screen?

Let's quickly define what you see.

*   **Workflow:** This is the entire project on your screen. It's a visual map of an automated task.
*   **Node:** A Node is a single **action block** in the workflow. Each block with an icon and a name (like the `Your First AI Agent` block or the `Get Weather` block) is a Node. It performs one specific job.
*   **Sticky Note:** These are the colored boxes with text, just like this one! They are here to explain things. They don't perform any actions.
*   **Credentials:** Think of these as **secret keys** or passwords. They let n8n securely connect to other apps (like Google).

## 2. How to Make This Workflow Work (4 Simple Steps)

You don't need to change anything to get started! Just follow these steps.

### **Step 1: Add Your AI Key**
This workflow needs an AI "brain" to think. By default, it uses the **Gemini** Node. You just need to give it your free key from Google.

1.  Find the **Gemini** Node on the screen (it has a blue and purple swirl icon).
2.  Look at the red Sticky Note right below it named `How to Get Google Gemini Credentials`.
3.  Follow the simple instructions on that note to get your key and add it to the Gemini Node.
    *   *To open a Node's settings, just **double-click** it. A large window will pop up in the center of your screen.*

### **Step 2: Turn the Workflow On**
Now, let's activate the workflow.
1.  Look at the **top-right corner** of the screen.
2.  You'll see a switch that says **"Inactive"**. Click it.
3.  It will turn green and say **"Active"**. Your agent is now live!

### **Step 3: Get Your Chat Link**
Time to find the link to your chat window.
1.  Find the Node with the chat bubble icon (üí¨), named `Example Chat Window`.
2.  **Double-click it**. A window will pop up.
3.  Inside that window, you'll see a **Chat URL**. Just **click on the link itself**. A small message will appear in the bottom-right corner of your screen telling you it's copied.

### **Step 4: Start Chatting!**
Open a new tab in your web browser, paste the link you just copied and press Enter. Your AI Agent's chat window will appear!

## 3. What About the Grayed-Out Nodes? (Optional)

You might notice some Nodes look gray and are deactivated (like `OpenAI`, `Get Upcoming Events`, and `Send Email`).

**You can ignore these completely!**

They are turned off on purpose to prevent errors. The OpenAi node can be configured with your AI Agent to use Chat GPT instead of Google Gemini. The bonus tools are optional "superpowers" you can add later if you want to (to give access to your Google Calendar and Gmail). The workflow is designed to work perfectly without them.

## 4. Want to Learn More n8n Basics?

If you feel like this template workflow is still hard to understand, these other hands-on tutorials are the perfect next step:

*   [**Learn JSON Basics**](https://n8n.io/workflows/5170-learn-json-basics-with-an-interactive-step-by-step-tutorial-for-beginners/): Understand how data moves in n8n.
*   [**Learn n8n Expressions**](https://n8n.io/workflows/5271-learn-n8n-expressions-with-an-interactive-step-by-step-tutorial-for-beginners/): The real magic of making your workflows dynamic.
*   [**Learn API Fundamentals**](https://n8n.io/workflows/5171-learn-api-fundamentals-with-an-interactive-hands-on-tutorial-workflow/): See how apps talk to each other.
*   [**Learn n8n Keyboard Shortcuts**](https://n8n.io/workflows/5270-learn-n8n-keyboard-shortcuts-with-an-interactive-hands-on-tutorial-workflow/): Work faster on the canvas.

## Video Tutorial

Complete Video Tutorial of this Template is coming soon !
It will be displayed here (if you download the updated template).
